summary: The document is a confidential FBI report detailing the activities and background of Felipe Vidal Santiago, a Cuban refugee and former Cuban Naval Attache who defected from the Castro government. It outlines his involvement in anti-Castro clandestine activities in the Miami area, his associations with various anti-Castro organizations, and his suspected participation in missions against the Castro regime, including arms transportation and attempts to infiltrate Cuba. The report also includes information from informants about Santiago's connections and activities, as well as his physical description and personal details.
key_findings: Felipe Vidal Santiago was a Cuban refugee who defected from the Castro government and was involved in anti-Castro clandestine activities.
He was associated with various anti-Castro organizations in Miami and was reported to have participated in missions against the Castro regime, including transporting arms.
Informants provided information suggesting Santiago's involvement in clandestine missions, including an attempt to infiltrate Cuba with arms worth $80,000.
The document includes detailed personal information about Santiago, including his physical description, family, and background.
